normalised: The healthcare industry in India is undergoing a massive transformation, and one often-overlooked aspect is the standardized use of units of measurement. normalised: Recently, there's been a big push to ensure everyone uses the same language when it comes to measurements. A reading of, say, one hundred and twenty milligram per deciliter can be confusing, especially for patients who are used to the other system. Standardizing to, let's say, six point six millimole per liter eliminates ambiguity.
